newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK property firm seen in HK$260 mln IPO - sources.
newsitem.headline: HK property firm seen in HK$260 mln IPO - sources.

text.p: Hong Kong-based property group Wah Tak Fung Holdings Ltd was expected to raise HK$260 million in an initial public offering of shares later in September, industry sources said on Wednesday.
The company was expected to issue 138 million new shares at HK$1.88 per share, representing a fully diluted price to earnings ratio of 12, the sources said.
The issue price represents a 32 percent discount to its net asset value of HK$2.76 per share, they said.
"Proceeds will be used to fund its property development projects," said an analyst who attended the company's flotation presentation.
Wah Tak Fung's property portfolio covers a total gross floor area of 44,717 square metres, valued at HK$2.565 billion, the industry sources added.
This is made up of office and residential property in the proportion of 84 and 16 percent respectively, they said.
Crosby Capital is the sponsor of the issue.
Public offering is expected to begin later in September and listing of shares is expected to begin in early October.

The company posted a turnover of HK$243.9 million for the year ended March 31, 1996, up from HK$161.15 million in 1995 and HK$211.9 million in 1994. Profit for 1995 was at HK$62.3 million, HK$57.1 million for 1995 and HK$56.1 million for 1994.
The company forecast its profit after tax to be not less than HK$80 million for the year ending in 1997, the sources said.
